title: 10-year-old killed in hunting accident identified
content:
CACHE COUNTY — Police identified the 10-year-old boy who was shot and killed while hunting Saturday.
Smithfield resident Zachary Woodruff was sitting on the floorboard of a four-wheeler in attempt to stay out of the wind when another hunter he was with tried to take out his rifle from his own four-wheeler.
The rifle then fired, and Woodruff died on scene. Police are calling the incident an accident, though it is still under investigation. Police said no charges are currently pending.
No additional information was released.
Always control the muzzle of the weapon, especially when loaded
Be certain of your target before firing
Know you're surroundings, especially what is in front or behind you at all times
Do not ride on an ATV with a loaded weapon
Source: Ja Eggett, Utah Division of Wildlife Resources
Contributing: Andrew Adams
